alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 2:06PM PDT until September 03 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Nevada, including the following counties, in north central Nevada, Eureka and Lander. In northeast Nevada, Elko. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elko, Carlin, Emigrant Pass, Palisade, Dunphy, Beowawe, Pine Valley, South Fork, Crescent Valley, Argenta, Spring Creek, Ryndon, Jiggs, South Area Mine, North Area Mine, Emigrant Mine, Adobe Summit, Lamoille Summit and Mule Canyon Reclamation Project. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
